review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n NhÃ¬n Ra ThÃ nh Phá»‘
review.comment_positive: The manager was really friendly and made sure that our stay was comfortable. He even offered us free breakfast which was not included in the booking. The hotel also helped with the booking of a day cruise and kept to the agreed price pre-trip even though the price of the package raised when we were there. There was a seafood restaurant nearby that was delicious and priced fairly.
review.comment_negative: Even though the room interior looks decent, the ratings shown on the site was an over-perception of how great the accommodation really is. Previous reviews rated the place too highly from what it should actually be as we were disappointed by the cleanliness and overall comfort of the stay. The mattress was springy, the bedsheets and pillow cases were slightly stained, there were hairs and some dirt on the floor. The hotel lobby was also very hot with no air conditioning. Moreover, the rooms were not soundproofed at all and a lot of noise can be heard from outside. We stayed during the peak season of holiday for the locals and there were many other local guests in our level, who tend to be extremely loud even during quiet hours at night. This shouldnâ€™t be an excuse for the noise though, as I feel that adequate sound proofing should be a bare minimum for the privacy of guests for a hotel room.

review.comment_positive:
Very welcoming staff who offered impeccable service and went out of their way to ensure a comfortable and pleasant stay. Staff were incredibly friendly, full of smiles and offered tea on arrival and free bottles of water.
They coordinated transport, organised cruise deals and made the whole stay stress free and enjoyable.
Breakfast was generous. Best hot shower I had enjoyed in Vietnam and only 5 minutes drive from the cruise port. Would highly recommend!

review.rating: Nice hotel, spoiled a bit at the end
review.room_type: Suite Essence Vá»›i Táº§m NhÃ¬n Ra Quang Cáº£nh Thanh BÃ¬nh
review.comment_positive:
- itâ€™s a very good three star hotel
- large comfortable beds
- nicely decorated 
- price per night is fair 
- helpful staff in booking taxis and giving area information
review.comment_negative:
- Being on hassled on check out to leave a review, we would have happily done one in our own time and given a 9/10 (as we were happy with our stay) but we werenâ€™t allowed to leave before doing so and then the receptionist told me it couldnâ€™t be a 9 and had to be a 10. They then took a photo of the review and called the hotel owner to check we were allowed to pay and checkout. Hence why we are adjusting this review score down.  Honestly itâ€™s not worth the 10% discount they offer you to leave it, as it has to be a 10. They are now sending us WhatsAppâ€™s which just seems unprofessional, I feel bad for the receptionist as they seem to live in fear of the hotel owner. 
-this isnâ€™t a fault of the property but in low season itâ€™s a ghost town, no where to even get dinner we ended up going to a store and buying instant noodles. We ended up going to a hotel a few roads down and paying to use their pool and facilitates for the day. If youâ€™re staying in the area get somewhere with a pool or at least something to do during the day. Nothing to do at the beach either, no beds,  canâ€™t swim in sea. If youâ€™re doing a cruise go straight there. 
- we had to change the dates of our arrival which we have done at lots of hotels in Vietnam and have never been charged an extra day. Especially as we were the only hotel occupants most of the time. It was hardly preventing anyone else from booking in.

Die Unterkunft liegt etwas auÃŸerhalb, aber fuÃŸlÃ¤ufig zum Strand. Dort darf man wohl nicht schwimmen, weshalb man davon nicht viel hat. Leider war die Sprachbarriere bei ein paar Mitarbeitern doch recht groÃŸ, Kommunikation lief Ã¼berwiegend mit Ãœbersetzer oder gar nicht. 

Zu unserer frÃ¼hen Abreise wurden uns zwei Wasserflaschen mitgegeben. Das fanden wir sehr nett. 

Das Zimmer war nicht besonders groÃŸ, aber hatte ausreichend Platz. Das Badezimmer ist durch eine Scheibe mit dem Schlafzimmer verbunden, die Idee fanden wir cool. Wenn das einem nicht gefÃ¤llt, kann man das Rollo einfach runterziehen. 

Ein Mitarbeiter meldet sich per WhatsApp und bemÃ¼ht sich einem WÃ¼nsche zu erfÃ¼llen.

review.comment_positive:
- Friendly staff
- They offered us free breakfast as they couldn't manage an early check-in
- If you are looking for a calm place near the beach and if you don't have a problem to walk for 2-3 kms to reach the crowded part of the city, the location can be good. Otherwise, you may find it too far or too quiet. For us it was an ideal location.
review.comment_negative: I can understand that the Halong Bay city has a special situation after covid. So in general, I respect and appreciate all the efforts that the staff of this hotel do to satisfy the clients even if there are some points to improve. However, there is one point that I didn't find fair, which is the fake photo on the Booking.com. We booked a room with sea view and based on the photo on the website, we should have had a good view of the sea. But such a view is not possible as there are blocks of appartments in front of the hotel and even geographically, the sea cannot be as close as it can be seen in the photo. I didn't find this honest.

I would definitely stay here again and recommend this lovely hotel if youâ€™re looking for somewhere very peaceful to stay.

review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Gia Ä‘Ã¬nh Deluxe NhÃ¬n ra ThÃ nh phá»‘
review.comment_positive:
Our room was modern and very comfortable, with lots of space to leave 3 big suitcases next to each other. The room also featured high tech air-conditioning (built into the roof, with several exits? so the whole room cools down ). The bathroom was quite spacious and contained a big shower.
The hotel is very close to an absolutely gorgeous beach (3 min on foot), which was pretty empty until 4 or 5 pm. It's a sandy beach with lots of palm trees for shade - the water is not very deep but deep enough to swim. Walking towards the east for a few minutes, you get to a bunch of beach bars with plenty of nightlife (some of them can be very expensive, but most of them are alright) - there even was a (techno) concert? on Friday.
review.comment_negative: Not the fault of the hotel but generally Vietnam: there is lots of trash everywhere (many people just throw stuff they don't need anymore on the ground) and the walls and windows don't really keep out any sounds (hello 8 am karaoke).

review.comment_positive: In a very quite area. We were charmed by  the location. It is in a bit of a Ghost town. We enjoyed strolling the streets with no one around. The street the hotel is located on, all the  store fronts have a Art Deco 1920s 30s feel, like you are on a movie set . It was certainly  something to experience and for the price we would recommend this hotel. A tip would be for dinner catch a taxi to the part of Halong that the locals eat. Also the Sea Cafe doen the end of the street serves a great coffee.

review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Superior GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n
review.comment_positive:
We only stayed two nights but had a very good time. The staff is professional and very friendly. We were lucky because they gave us an upgraded room without any extra charge when we checked in. All of the staff were very polite and helpful with all our inquiries. Everything was taken care of right away (laundry came back fresh and clean the same day, problems with the safe (our fault) or booking a tour).
The room was clean, modern and looked like the pictures you see online. The bed is comfortable and clean. We had a stable and fast wifi connection, enough hot water and a good breakfast with a variety of options.
The hotel is located in a quiet and safe area and just a few walking minutes away from a beautiful beach. We rented a scooter at the reception and in only about 10-15 Minuten your at the city center. 
It was a great stay and we would love to come back.

review.room_type: Suite Essence Vá»›i Táº§m NhÃ¬n Ra Quang Cáº£nh Thanh BÃ¬nh
review.comment_positive:
****READ ME!!!!**** This hotel asks you for a written review and feedback at the end of your stay, which is totally normal and expected. However, after giving an honest review of about 7/10, they ask to change the score to a 9 or 10! they say due to covid theyâ€™re struggling, but honestly, this left a sour taste in my mouth and actually led me to leaving this review - which I wouldnâ€™t have done before. the hotel itself is fine, 3/5 I say is accurate. itâ€™s simple, but has the basics. 

some conditioner and body lotion would be good for the bathroom. there was also a smell that came from the toilet after 2 days. 

now here comes the interesting bit. not sure if itâ€™s a timing thing, but Halong city is DEAD. at the moment. FULL ON GHOST TOWN. My advice would be to come to Halong for a day trip or cruise from Haiphong or Hanoi, but donâ€™t bother with overnight. it was extremely difficult to find food, entertainment, andâ€¦ people? 

we were here Christmas Eve and ended up going to a swanky commercial hotel as we figured that would be the only reliable place 

the hotel is located next to the beach though which is lovely.

review.rating: Excellent service at a pleasant boutique hotel.
review.room_type: Suite Essence Vá»›i Táº§m NhÃ¬n Ra Quang Cáº£nh Thanh BÃ¬nh
review.comment_positive:
Beautiful boutique hotel on the main street of a newly refurbished area of Ha Long Bay. 

The hotel manager and all the staff were extremely helpful and courteous and made our stay pleasant.  

We asked for advice for a seafood restaurant, and were guided to a most pleasant restaurant with delicious entrees at reasonable prices.  The hotel staff arranged for taxi transport.

We went on a cruise the next day and the hotel staff called our cruise company and made sure that we had all the details necessary. the next morning, after check out, there was a taxi waiting for us and the hotel manager ensured that we arrived with plenty of time for check in for our cruise.

Fantastic service at an amazing price for a beautiful boutique hotel!
review.comment_negative: Nothing to dislike.  everything was perfect.

review.rating: Wenn es rein im das Hotel geht, wÃ¼rden wir sofort wiederkommen! :)
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Superior GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n
review.comment_positive: Das Hotel ist wundervoll! Es sieht sehr hÃ¼bsch aus, die Einrichtung ist sehr schÃ¶n und stilvoll. Mir gefÃ¤llt das Schwarz mit dem Blauton sehr! Die Matratzen sind bequem und keine Panik im Badezimmer: FÃ¼r ausreichend PrivatsphÃ¤re sorgt ein Rollo der bei Bedarf heruntergezogen werden kann. :) Zum FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck kÃ¶nnen wir leider nichts sagen, da wir auÃŸerhalb gegessen haben, aber es wird auf jeden Fall im Hotel angeboten. Das Personal ist sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit, es gibt kleine Sprachbarrieren aber das Personal hat sofort den Google SprachÃ¼bersetzer parat. Damit funktionierte es sehr gut, auch der Herr welcher unser GepÃ¤ck bei Abreise in das Taxi geladen hat und uns beim Einsteigen geholfen hat, war super aufmerksam. :) Die Lage ist super um schnell an den Hafen zu gelangen um die Halong Bucht zu besichtigen.
review.comment_negative:
Die Unterkunft ist super, es liegt eher an der Lage. Das ist unsere persÃ¶nliche Meinung, aber in Vietnam werden teilweise groÃŸe Areale gebaut, welche nichts mehr mit Vietnam / Asien zu tun haben und das ist nicht das, wonach wir auf unserer Abenteuerreise in VN suchten. Diese Bezirke sollen Italien oder anderen europÃ¤ischen StÃ¤dte Ã¤hneln und so sind diese auch vom Stil her gebaut. Gerade dieser Distrikt wirkt leer, die meisten HÃ¤user sind leer und unbewohnt, was dem Besucher ein unheimliches GefÃ¼hl vermittelt. Ich wÃ¼nsche den Firmen und dem Hotel, dass sich  - jetzt nach Covid - noch mehr Leben dort ansiedeln wird. Da wir selbst aus Europa sind, wollen wir eher das typische Vietnam sehen. 

Wir haben uns einen Roller gemietet. Das Hotel hat es sehr schnell organisiert und die Roller wurden von einer externen Firma geliefert. Der Mann war leider etwas unhÃ¶flich in seiner Ausdrucksweise was uns sehr verschreckt hat. Ich nehme an, dass er schlechte Erfahrungen mit Touristen gemacht hat, aber trotzdem war es unangebracht und nicht so gut fÃ¼r das Image des Hotels. Hier sollte das Personal nochmal RÃ¼cksprache halten - abgesehen davon, waren es aber gut funktionierende Roller!

review.rating: Unhelpful staff that caused me 36 hours of unnecessary anguish.
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n NhÃ¬n Ra ThÃ nh Phá»‘
review.comment_positive: Whilst the hotel was ok in terms of its facilities, the attitude of the staff completely ruined my stay. To explain, whilst in Ha Long Bay my passport went missing and, as can be imagined, I was distraught (I was scheduled to fly to Hoi An 2 days later). Despite my obvious distress, the hotel staff were only concerned with proving that they had returned the passport to me further to check in - they did not try to help me find the passport. It was only when I arrived at the Meritel Hotel in Hanoi, the day after my stay at the Ha Long Essence, that the reception staff rang the police station in Ha Long Bay and located my passport. The passport had been found in a casino in Ha Long Bay and had been handed in (I had not been in the casino so can only assume that someone was trying to use the passport for financial gain). If it hadn't been for the efforts of the staff at the Meritel Hotel I would not have got my passport back. The Meritel staff arranged for me to confirm my identity via video chat and arranged for a taxi driver to bring the passport to me in Hanoi rather than me having to travel back to Ha Long Bay to collect the passport. If the staff at the Ha Long Essence had been as helpful as the staff at the Meritel, my anguish would have have been for a shorter period of time and I could have collected the passport whilst I was still in Ha Long Bay. Such a shame that the staff let the hotel down.
review.comment_negative: The attitude of the staff.
